notes: This is the maximum temperature tolerated by salmonids, although they tend to avoid waters that are over 20 degrees C.

Turbidity Threshold derived from this publication: Sigler, J. W., T.C. Bjornn, and F.H. Everest. 1984. Effects of chronic turbidity on density and growth of steelhead and coho salmon. Transactions of the American Fisheries Society 113:142-150.
This threshold is based on the potential for eutrophication, rather than direct nitrate toxicity.
1 hour average at pH 7 and 20 degrees C
This threshold applies to Fecal Coliform levels in areas with water contact recreation.
No threshold; it impacts the toxicity of dissolved metals, but is not toxic itself.
